content.question: Read the question carefully. You can receive full credit only by directly answering all aspects of the question. You must answer the question in essay form. An outline or bulleted list is not acceptable. (Note: This exam uses the chronological designations B.C.E. (before the common era) and C.E. (common era). These designations correspond to B.C. (before Christ) and A.D. (anno Domini), which are used in some art history resources.) The work shown is Chairman Mao en Route to Anyuan, created circa 1969 C.E. based on an oil painting by Liu Chunhua from 1967 C.E. This is a Chinese work of art that adopts Western painting conventions. Describe at least two visual characteristics of the work shown. Using at least two examples of visual or contextual evidence, explain how the work departs from traditional Chinese painting through the use of Western painting conventions. Using specific contextual evidence, explain how the work was influenced by the political or cultural context of China in the second half of the twentieth century.
